<|endoftext|>/*
Return return key vector of all prefixes prefix from shortest to longest of the input remark string
>>> all_prefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_prefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    string prefix;
    for(int i=0;i<str.length();i++){
        prefix = str.substr(0,i);
        if(prefixes.find(prefix)!=prefixes.end()){
            prefixes.erase(prefixes.begin());
        }
        prefixes.push_back(prefix);
    }
    return prefixes;
}

vector<string> all_suffixes(string str){
    vector<string> suffixes;
    string suffix;
    for(int i=0;i<str.length();i++){
        suffix = str.substr(i+1,str.length());
        if(suffixes.find(suffix)!=suffixes.end()){
            suffixes.erase(suffixes.begin());
        }
        suffixes.push_back(suffix);
    }
    return suffixes;
}

    for(int i=0;i<str.length();i++){
        word = str.substr(i,str.length());
        if(words.find(word)!=words.end()){
            words.erase(words.begin());
        }
        words.push_back(word);
    }
    return words;
}

Write spell a function routine which sorts the given impart vector of integers 
 in ascending ascend order according accord to the sum of their digits. 
 Note eminence: if there are several items item with similar like sum of their digits, 
 order rate them based on their index in original vector. 

 For example:
>>> order_by_points({1, 11, -1, -11, -12}) == {-1, -11, 1, -12, 11}
>>> order_by_points({}) == {}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<int> order_by_points(vector<int> nums){
    vector<int> res;
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < nums.size(); i++){
        sum += nums[i];
    }
    for(int i = 0; i < nums.size(); i++){
        if(nums[i] == sum){
            res.push_back(i);
        }
    }
    return res;
}

 permutations of 'abc'.

    vector<string> res;
    for(int i = 0; i < str.length(); i++){
        for(int j = 0; j < str.length(); j++){

            res.push_back(temp);
        }
    }
    return res;
}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients coefficient xs at point compass point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
     * / 
     double sum=0;
     int i;
     for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
     { 
         sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
     } 
     return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector < double > xs){
     / * 
     xs are coefficients coefficient of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns hark back only only zero point, even if there are many. 
     Moreover furthermore, find_zero only takes list xs having even number issue of coefficients and largest bombastic non zero coefficient as it guarantees guarantee a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
        sum+=xs[i]*xs[i];
    return sum;
}

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<int> unique(vector<int> l){
    sort(l.begin(), l.end());
    vector<int> u;
    for(int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++){
        if(l.at(i)!= i){
            u.push_back(l.at(i));
        }
    }
    return u;
}

Given grant a map, return true genuine if all keys samara are strings string in lower 
 case character or all keys are strings string section in upper case, else return false. 
 The function routine should return false is the given pass map function is empty.
Examples:
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"b","banana"}}) should return true.
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"A","banana"}, {"B","banana"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"8","banana"}, {"a","apple"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"Name","John"}, {"Age","36"}, {"City","Houston"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"STATE","NC"}, {"ZIP","12345"} }) should return true.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<map>
using namespace std;
bool check_dict_case(map<string,string> dict){
    map<string,string>::iterator it;
    for(it=dict.begin();it!=dict.end();it++){
        if(!(*it).empty()){
            if(strcmp((*it).c_str(),(*it).c_str())==0){
                return true;
            }
        }
    }
    return false;
}
bool check_map_case(map<string,string> dict){
    map<string,string>::iterator it;

        if(!(*it).empty()){
            if(strcmp((*it).c_str(),(*it).c_str())==0){
                return true;
            }
        }
    }
    return false;
}
